sen.j: 鷹司 景子（たかつかさ ひろこ、文化 (元号)10年11月24日 (旧暦)（1814年1月15日） - 明治25年8月8日 (旧暦)（1892年9月28日））は江戸時代の女性。
sen.e: Hiroko TAKATSUKASA (January 15, 1814 - September 28, 1892) was a woman in the Edo period.
Hiroko TAKATSUKASA (January 15, 1814 - September 28, 1892) was a woman in the Edo period.
Hiroko TAKATSUKASA (January 15, 1814 - September 28, 1892) was a woman in the Edo period.
She was a wife of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie.
She was a wife of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie.
She was a wife of Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Kuniie.
She was a daughter of Masahiro TAKATSUKASA, Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor).
She was a daughter of Masahiro TAKATSUKASA, Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor).
She was a daughter of Masahiro TAKATSUKASA, Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor).

sen.j: 姉妹には、閑院宮孝仁親王の妃の鷹司吉子、仁孝天皇の女御の鷹司繋子（新皇嘉門院）、同じく仁孝天皇の女御の鷹司祺子（新朔平門院）、将軍徳川家定の正室の鷹司任子がいる。
sen.e: She had sisters including Chikako (吉子) TAKATSUKASA, a wife of Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya, Tsunako TAKATSUKASA (Shinnokamonin), a nyogo (consort) of Emperor Ninko, Yasuko TAKATSUKASA (Shinsakuheimonin), a nyogo of Emperor Ninko, and Atsuko TAKATSUKASA, the lawful wife of shogun, Iesada TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: 「鷹司吉子」の読み不明「鷹司繋子（新皇嘉門院）」は<http://www.geocities.jp/japanischekonigsfamilien/japan/120-kogo.html>を参照「鷹司任子」は<http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%B7%B9%E5%8F%B8%E4%BB%BB%E5%AD%90>を参照
sen.e: She had sisters including Chikako (吉子) TAKATSUKASA, a wife of Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya, Tsunako TAKATSUKASA (Shinnokamonin), a nyogo (consort) of Emperor Ninko, Yasuko TAKATSUKASA (Shinsakuheimonin), a nyogo of Emperor Ninko, and Atsuko TAKATSUKASA, the lawful wife of shogun, Iesada TOKUGAWA.

She had sisters including Chikako (吉子) TAKATSUKASA, a wife of Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya, Tsunako TAKATSUKASA (Shinnokamonin), a nyogo (consort) of Emperor Ninko, Yasuko TAKATSUKASA (Shinsakuheimonin), a nyogo of Emperor Ninko, and Atsuko TAKATSUKASA, the lawful wife of shogun, Iesada TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 邦家親王の祖父伏見宮邦頼親王の妃の鷹司昌子は景子の伯母にあたる。
sen.e: Her aunt was Masako TAKATSUKASA, a wife of Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Kuniyori who was Prince Kuniie's grandfather.
Her aunt was Masako TAKATSUKASA, a wife of Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Kuniyori who was Prince Kuniie's grandfather.
Her aunt was Masako TAKATSUKASA, a wife of Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Kuniyori who was Prince Kuniie's grandfather.

sen.j: 天保6年（1835年）11月21日に邦家親王と結婚する。
sen.e: She got married to Prince Kuniie on November 21, 1835.
She got married to Prince Kuniie on November 21, 1835.
She got married to Prince Kuniie on November 21, 1835.

sen.j: 邦家親王との間には伏見宮貞教親王、則子女王（紀州藩の最後の藩主徳川茂承の正室）、伏見宮貞愛親王などがいる。
sen.e: She had children of Prince Kuniie including Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori, Princess Noriko (the lawful wife of Mochitsugu TOKUGAWA, the last lord of the Kishu Domain) and Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori.

She had children of Prince Kuniie including Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori, Princess Noriko (the lawful wife of Mochitsugu TOKUGAWA, the last lord of the Kishu Domain) and Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori.

She had children of Prince Kuniie including Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori, Princess Noriko (the lawful wife of Mochitsugu TOKUGAWA, the last lord of the Kishu Domain) and Imperial Prince Fushiminomiya Sadanori.
